The project "The African Millennium Villages Initiative Uganda - RAF/05/023" is funded by the Government of Japan through Human Security Unit Trust fund at UN/OCHA.
Projet des Villages du Millénaire de Louga (MV1) Senegal.

donor_name: JOINT UNITED NATIONS PROGRAMME ON HIV/AIDS
outputs.output_descr: Conduct an assessment on Millennium Village Strategy under the assumption that US$110 per person per year provides sufficient means to raise a person out of poverty.
Support to the establishement of a Millenium Village in Pampaida, Kaduna State

The Millennium Village project is an integrated rural development project which will improve the lives of the people in the villages in the areas of Agriculture, Education, Health and Infrastructure. The project aims to attain the MDGs in 5 years with an additional investment of $50 per person per year. The coordination unit at HQ is to ensure swift implementation of the project trhough the country office, good relationship with the partners / donors and providing guidance and support for expansion (new MVs) and national MDG scale up programs.

The Millennium Villages aims to establish a rigorous proof of concept for implementing the practical interventions needed to achieve MDGs in Rural Africa over a five years time frame. Based on $50 per person per year the project aims at improving people's lives with special emphasis to areas of Agriculture, Education, Health and Infrastructure.Eliminate hunger and malnutrition,improved maternal health, increased assess to energy, digital gaps bridged in pursuit of the MDGs in selected villages.
